text: Ancient Meitei or Old Manipuri was the early form of the present day Meitei language (Manipuri language) and was the national language of Ancient Manipur.http://multitree.org/codes/omp The language is as old as the reign of Emperor "Tangja Leela Pakhangba" in Ancient Manipur, right from 1445 BC, and was spoken upto the beginning of the Medieval Manipur. ==Gallery== File:Wakching.jpg File:A picture of a Puya (ancient Meitei text).jpg File:A_picture_of_pages_of_Wakoklon_Puya.jpg ==Related pages== # Puya (Meitei texts) # List of Puyas ==References== ;General references * Khelchandra Ningthoukhongjam Singh, History Of Old Manipuri Literature https://archive.org/details/in.ernet.dli.2015.466183 * Iboyaima Laithangbam, Banished Manipuri script stages a comeback, September 23, 2017 https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/other-states/banished-manipuri-script- stages-a-comeback/article19743482.ece Category:Sino-Tibetan languages
title: Ancient Meitei language
